key_responsibilities: Work on constituent cases, predominantly for veterans
attend events as the Congressman’s representative
monitor and update the Member and District Director on district and local issues
act as liaison with federal, district, and local agencies for the Member and constituents
perform other related duties as assigned
requirements: excellent organizational, collaboration and communication skills
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Congressman’s position on policy issues
ability to multi task and work under pressure to meet deadlines
flexibility with priorities and ever-changing deadlines
ability to meet attendance requirements including a varied and work schedule

key_responsibilities: filming/editing videos
posting to social media
photographing events
writing/producing newsletters
maintaining the website
speech writing
drafting constituent mail
researching policy issues
other responsibilities as assigned
developing and managing the Member’s daily schedule and travel arrangements
organizing the Member’s daily briefing materials
occasionally driving the Member to events
evaluating all incoming invitations and meeting requests
communicating with constituents by phone and email quickly to address requests, concerns, and questions
maintaining office records and office supplies
serving as the emergency office coordinator
performing other duties as required
requirements: poise and ability to thrive in a fast paced environment

key_responsibilities: answering telephones
assisting with the tracking and processing of committee correspondence
providing administrative support in setting up committee meetings
entering data and navigating databases with accuracy
requirements: proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
ability to use good judgment in responding to inquiries and requests
flexibility in assisting with daily tasks and projects

key_responsibilities: responding to constituent mail
monitoring House floor procedures
assisting the legislative director with drafting legislation
meeting with constituents and interested individuals/organizations
preparing congressional record entries
assisting the communications director with updating the website and Facebook and Twitter pages
other duties as assigned
requirements: ability to manage multiple tasks and work well under pressure

key_responsibilities: greeting visitors
answering phones
scheduling and leading tours
responding to constituent requests for general information and other inquiries
maintaining the front office
assisting with various administrative duties
requirements: maintain a good relationship with the Member, staff, and constituents
willingness to accept performance based criticism and direction while working well under pressure
openness to having a flexible schedule

key_responsibilities: managing the Congressman’s D.C. schedule
tracking and responding to invitations
maintaining accurate lists of annual meetings and long-term planning
management of the intern program and junior staff
vouchering, reimbursements and budget tracking
management of office equipment and purchasing
None
requirements: excellent technical, written, and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: overseeing various issues including health care, education, oversight, and social issues
advising the Congressman on all legislative areas
assisting in the development of policy, communications and legislative initiatives
requirements: strong knowledge of health care issues

key_responsibilities: acting as the Member's primary liaison to all government, community and constituent groups and civic leaders
monitoring developments, opinions and concerns in the district and updating the Member accordingly
attending civic meetings, community gatherings, and other events, representing the Member when needed
directing the work of district outreach, case managers and other district staff in support of the office’s outreach plan
other administrative and management duties assigned
requirements: excellent oral and written communications skills
demonstrated initiative, including a proven capability to generate new ideas
ability to multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment
several years of experience in government and/or community outreach, media relations
solid ties to the district and South Florida
strong knowledge of local issues, geography and demographics

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
analyzing bills
meeting with constituents concerning policy matters
handling a diverse portfolio of policy issues, including budget and appropriations, commerce, defense, housing, social welfare, and taxation
requirements: libertarian or classical liberal in the tradition of F.A. Hayek, Henry Hazlitt, and Frédéric Bastiat
strong commitment to individual liberty, economic freedom, the Rule of Law, and the Constitution
degree in economics or at least two years of relevant policy experience preferred
